abstract: In the final, frantic months of 2008, Merrill traders apparently lost hundreds of millions on gambles that came to light only after its merger with Bank of America.
snippet: In the final, frantic months of 2008, Merrill traders apparently lost hundreds of millions on gambles that came to light only after its merger with Bank of America.
lead_paragraph: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  One Merrill Lynch trader apparently gambled away more than $120 million in the currency markets. Others seemingly lost hundreds of millions on tricky credit derivatives.

headline.main: Undisclosed Losses at Merrill Lynch Lead to a Trading Inquiry

byline.original: By Louise Story and Eric Dash

abstract: A group that works with union pension funds called for the ouster of Bank of America Chairman and Chief Executive Kenneth D. Lewis, citing the bank’s falling stock price and damage from its acquisition of Merrill Lynch.
lead_paragraph: A group that works with union pension funds called for the ouster of Bank of America Chairman and Chief Executive Kenneth D. Lewis, citing the bank’s falling stock price and damage from its acquisition of Merrill Lynch.

headline.main: Union Group Seeks Ouster of BofA Chief

abstract: The legal sqabble between Bank of America and New York Attorney General Andrew Cuomo over Merrill Lynch’s bonuses continued on Thursday and Friday, as the two sparred over testimony over a former senior Merrill executive.
snippet: The legal sqabble between Bank of America and New York Attorney General Andrew Cuomo over Merrill Lynch’s bonuses continued on Thursday and Friday, as the two sparred over testimony over a former senior Merrill executive.
lead_paragraph: Update | 6:37 p.m. The legal squabble between Bank of America and New York Attorney General Andrew Cuomo over Merrill Lynch‘s bonuses continued on Thursday and Friday, as the two fought over testimony from several individuals, including a former senior Merrill executive.

headline.main: Cuomo and BofA Fight Over Bonus Data Testimony
